days.name: Like a GIF For Your Yard
Infinite Elves and Infinite Houses
days.description: Find and sum dividors of numbers
gotchas: Using the fundamental theorem of arithmentic (that every number N equals product (ith prime divisor)power, for example, 665280 = 26 33 51 71 111), we know that every divisor of N has the form of product (i-th prime divisor of N)power less or equal than the power of i-th prime divisor of N Lets iterate over the numbers with many divisors, explicitly compute every divisor and find our answer.
